page.title: 04SHOPS & PUBLIC HOUSES
page.content: Each of the villages is served by shops, one in each village, which supply the day to day necessities and also are Post Offices. They are also focal points for the villages and especially the surrounding areas, places for meeting people, for conversation and for catching up with the local news. Both sell newspapers and neither is licensed. Wellbank is served by a Public House, the Wellbank Arms. It is owned locally, which is the trend in Angus, and has a large function room, which caters for wedding receptions and many of the Dinners, Dances and Balls of our local organisations. Newbigging is not blessed with a Public House; its inhabitants much travel at least 2 km to quench their thirsts. A recent proposal to build a Public House was met with almost total resistance.
